posts.post_content: This card is exceptionally powerful in EDH, especially with cards like [Mimeoplasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mimeoplasm) or [Lord of Extinction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of Extinction). You can fill the graveyard with creatures from your hand, while pumping other creatures you control and giving your commander options. All the while you are filling your hand with creatures you want! Makes [Living Death](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Living Death )  or [Grimoire of the Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grimoire of the Dead) both devastating and brutal.
posts.html:
This card is exceptionally powerful in EDH, especially with cards like Mimeoplasm or Lord of Extinction. You can fill the graveyard with creatures from your hand, while pumping other creatures you control and giving your commander options. All the while you are filling your hand with creatures you want! Makes Living Death or Grimoire of the Dead both devastating and brutal.

posts.post_content:
I run 4 Fauna Shamans + 4 Elvish Pipers + Green Sun's Zenith + Captain Sisay, in a ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) deck to fetch legendary creatures. I couldn't give a crap if Fauna Shaman is a removal magnet since every turn brings me a creature that's even scarier. In essence, all my creatures are considered a huge threat.  
  
As my opponent is busy removing the 2-drops and 4-drops, I'm getting enough mana to play my legendary creatures. In fact, it's a lose-lose situation for my opponent with this deck. They must waste all their removal spells on Fauna and Piper or they'll lose even earlier. They will either run out of removal before I run out of threatening creatures or they won't be aggro enough to kill me since they're running only removal spells.  
  
"Dies to removal" is only something an MtG rookie would say.
posts.html:
I run 4 Fauna Shamans + 4 Elvish Pipers + Green Sun's Zenith + Captain Sisay, in a deck to fetch legendary creatures. I couldn't give a crap if Fauna Shaman is a removal magnet since every turn brings me a creature that's even scarier. In essence, all my creatures are considered a huge threat.

As my opponent is busy removing the 2-drops and 4-drops, I'm getting enough mana to play my legendary creatures. In fact, it's a lose-lose situation for my opponent with this deck. They must waste all their removal spells on Fauna and Piper or they'll lose even earlier. They will either run out of removal before I run out of threatening creatures or they won't be aggro enough to kill me since they're running only removal spells.

"Dies to removal" is only something an MtG rookie would say.
